pear.name: Pear Shape
pear.description: Your body shape is characterized by narrower shoulders and a fuller lower body. Your hips are wider than your shoulders, creating a beautiful feminine silhouette.

recommendations: Boat neck and off-shoulder styles to broaden shoulders
Embellished or detailed necklines to draw attention upward
Structured blazers and jackets with shoulder details
Bright colors and patterns on top
V-necks and scoop necks to elongate
avoid: Clingy fabrics on the lower body

recommendations: A-line skirts that skim over hips
Bootcut or flared jeans to balance proportions
avoid: Skinny jeans without balance on top
Cargo pants with large pockets on hips

recommendations: A-line dresses that flow from the waist
avoid: Dresses with heavy embellishment on hips

recommendations: Structured blazers that end at hip bone
Jackets with shoulder pads or details
avoid: Jackets that end at the widest part of hips

recommendations: Patterns and prints on top half
avoid: Large prints on hips and thighs
Clingy, thin fabrics on lower body

colorTips: Wear brighter colors and patterns on your upper body
Choose darker, solid colors for bottoms to create balance
Monochromatic looks can elongate your silhouette
Use color blocking to draw attention to your upper body
fitTips: Balance your proportions by adding volume to your shoulders
Define your waist with belts or fitted styles
Choose bottoms that skim rather than cling
Ensure proper fit in the hip area without excess fabric

hourglass.name: Hourglass Shape
hourglass.description: Your body shape features balanced shoulders and hips with a well-defined waist. This is considered a proportionate and curvy silhouette.

recommendations: Wrap tops that emphasize the waist
Fitted tops that follow your curves
avoid: Boxy, shapeless tops that hide curves
Low-rise pants that break the waist line

recommendations: Fitted blazers that nip at the waist
Fabrics with stretch that follow curves
avoid: Stiff, rigid fabrics that don't drape

colorTips: Monochromatic outfits elongate your silhouette
You can wear bold colors and patterns confidently
Color blocking at the waist emphasizes your curves
Both light and dark colors work well for your shape
fitTips: Always emphasize your waist - it's your best feature
Choose fitted styles that follow your natural curves
Avoid anything too loose or too tight
Tailoring is your friend - invest in proper fit

apple.name: Apple Shape
apple.description: Your body shape carries weight around the midsection with slimmer legs and arms. Your shoulders may be broader than your hips.

recommendations: V-neck and deep scoop necks to elongate
Flowy tunics that skim the midsection
Tops with vertical details or seams
Slim-fit jeans to show off legs
Skinny jeans (your legs can carry them)
avoid: Overly baggy pants that hide your legs

recommendations: Shift dresses that skim the body
Long cardigans that create vertical lines
Coats that end below the hip
avoid: Cropped jackets that end at waist

colorTips: Darker colors around the midsection create a slimming effect
Draw attention to your legs with brighter colors on bottoms
Monochromatic looks create a long, lean line
Use color to highlight your shoulders and legs
fitTips: Create vertical lines to elongate your torso
Show off your legs - they're a great asset
Avoid tight waistbands; opt for comfortable fits
Layer strategically to add dimension

rectangle.name: Rectangle Shape
rectangle.description: Your body shape has balanced shoulders, waist, and hips with minimal waist definition. You have a straight, athletic silhouette.

recommendations: Peplum tops to create waist definition
Ruffled or layered styles for dimension
avoid: Straight, boxy cuts that emphasize straightness

recommendations: Skinny jeans with volume on top
Cargo pants with pockets for dimension
avoid: Mid-rise straight cuts that emphasize straightness
All-over vertical stripes that emphasize straightness

colorTips: Use color blocking to create the illusion of curves
Horizontal stripes work great for your shape
Mix patterns and textures for visual interest
Don't be afraid of bold colors and prints
fitTips: Create curves with belts, peplums, and ruffles
Add volume strategically to create shape
Layer to add dimension to your silhouette
Experiment with different waist placements

inverted-triangle.name: Inverted Triangle Shape
inverted-triangle.description: Your body shape features broader shoulders and bust with narrower hips. You have an athletic, strong upper body.

avoid: Bright colors and patterns on shoulders

recommendations: Light colors and patterns on bottom
avoid: Skinny jeans without balance on top
Dark, plain bottoms with bright tops
Cropped jackets that end above hip

colorTips: Wear darker colors on top to minimize shoulders
Choose lighter colors and patterns for bottoms
Use color to draw attention to your lower body
Monochromatic looks can balance proportions
fitTips: Balance your proportions by adding volume to hips
Minimize shoulder width with strategic necklines
Define your waist to create an hourglass effect
Show off your legs - they're a great feature
